com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.locking

Class AbstractLocker.Builder<S,B extends AbstractLocker.Builder<S,B>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.locking.AbstractLocker.Builder<S,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The concrete type of LockStatus
    B - The concrete type of the subclass extending this builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsistentKeyLocker.Builder
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractLocker<S extends LockStatus>

    public abstract static class AbstractLocker.Builder<S,B extends AbstractLocker.Builder<S,B>>
extends Object
    Abstract builder for this Locker implementation. See ConsistentKeyLocker for an example of how to subclass this abstract builder into a concrete builder.

    If you're wondering why the bounds for the type parameter B looks so hideous, see:

    Using the builder pattern with subclasses by Eamonn McManus

      • internalState

        public B internalState(LockerState<S> state)
        This method is only intended for testing. Calling this in production could cause lock failures.
        Parameters:
        state - the initial lock state for this instance
        Returns:
        this builder

      • preBuild

        protected void preBuild()
        Inspect and modify this builder's state after the client has called build(), but before a return object has been instantiated. This is useful for catching illegal values or translating placeholder configuration values into the objects they represent. This is intended to be called from subclasses' build() methods.

      • getDefaultMediator

        protected abstract LocalLockMediator<StoreTransaction> getDefaultMediator()
        Get the default LocalLockMediator for Locker being built. This is called when the client doesn't specify a locker.
        Returns:
        a lock mediator
